Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 541990: All Other Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: On October 7, 2010, the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) Office of Health, Safety and Security's Office of Enforcement issued a Preliminary Notice of Violation (WEA-2010-06) to Parsons Infrastructure & Technology Group, Inc. for violations of 10 C.F.R. 851 related to a hand injury that occurred while a worker was performing crane lubrication on October 6, 2009, at the Salt Waste Processing Facility at t DOE's Savannah River Site.

Company: Parsons Infrastructure and Technology Group, Inc.
Description: On April 13, 2010, the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) Office of Health, Safety and Security's Office of Enforcement issued a Consent Order to Parsons Infrastructure and Technology Group, Inc. for deficiencies in the oversight of suppliers of nuclear grade construction materials for the Salt Waste Processing Facility at DOE's Savannah River Site. The contractor agreed to the Consent Order.

Parsons Government Services Inc. agreed to pay the United States $3.8 million to settle allegations that the company knowingly mischarged the U.S. Department of Energy for ineligible or inflated short-term and long-term employee relocation costs in connection with its contract for the DOE Salt Waste Processing Facility Project at the DOE Savannah River Site in Aiken, South Carolina.
